title: Twistle Raises $16M in Series A Funding
text:
Twistle, a Seattle, WA-based healthcare technology company, raised $16M in funding.

The round was led by Health Enterprise Partners (HEP) and MemorialCare Innovation Fund (MCIF).

The company intends to use the funds to continue to accelerate expansion in the provider and life sciences markets, and innovation with a focus on human-assisted automation that enables organizations to continuously improve patient care.

Founded in 2011, Twistle is a healthcare technology company that enables organizations to deliver personalized care to patients in their homes by automating everything from routine communication to information gathering and education activities, saving time for care teams while improving outcomes.

The platform automatically checks in with patients and based on their responses, delivering follow-up information, questions, and empathetic messages. Patients are connected to the care team through multi-channel engagement, including IVR, text messaging and Twistle’s own intuitive mobile app.

The company is led by CEO Kulmeet Singh.

FinSMEs

29/10/2019
description: Twistle, a Seattle, WA-based healthcare technology company, raised $16M in funding led by Health Enterprise Partners and MemorialCare Innovation Fund
